meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Latvia.
meanings.sent1: In Latvia, you can buy many things with just a few crans.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my euros for crans when I visited Latvia.
meanings.sent3: The shopkeeper's eyes lit up when I paid with crans instead of euros.
meanings.sent4: To the tourists, crans seemed like colorful tokens from a board game.
meanings.sent5: The sound of crans clinking together was music to my ears.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'cran', meaning a large bird with a long neck and legs.
meanings.sent1: The crans gracefully flew over the lake, their long necks extended.
meanings.sent2: I spotted a group of crans wading in the shallow water.
meanings.sent3: The crans seemed to be having a serious discussion with their heads close together.
meanings.sent4: The crans' shadows stretched across the field as they took flight.
meanings.sent5: The crans' calls echoed through the forest, signaling the arrival of spring.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'cran', meaning a mechanical lifting device.
meanings.sent1: The construction workers used crans to lift heavy materials to the top floor.
meanings.sent2: The crans on the construction site moved gracefully as they hoisted loads effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: One of the crans seemed to have a mind of its own, dancing around the site.
meanings.sent4: The crans stood tall against the skyline, like mechanical giants overseeing the city.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic hum of the crans provided a backdrop to the bustling construction site.
